Job Title: Fee for Service Evaluator / Facilitator

Location: New Britain, CT

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Education, Training

Description:
Wheeler's vision is that all people will have the opportunity to grow, change and live healthier, productive lives. Our mission is to provide equitable access to innovative care that improves health, recovery and growth at all stages of life.

Position Summary

The PTIP Evaluator/Facilitator provides intake assessments and psycho-educational group services for Pre-Trial Drug and Alcohol Education clients and makes recommendations to the court, including recommendations for level of program and/or treatment when necessary.

Education And Experience/Qualifications

Candidate must either have:

 License or Certification in one of the following with 1 year of experience working with substance abusing clients: LADC LCSW LPC LMFT MD/DO CAC CADC Master’s degree in Marriage and Family Therapy, Counseling, Social Work or related license eligible field or a doctoral degree in Psychology. Bachelors degree with 1 year of experience providing services to adults with substance use disorders.

 LOCATION 

New Britain, Waterbury, CT

 SCHEDULE 

Fee for service

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Co-facilitates psycho-educational groups for CSSD referred clients.

Provides intake assessments for Pre-Trial Drug and Alcohol Education clients and makes recommendations to the court for level of program and/or treatment when necessary

Provides case management duties (telephone contact with clients regarding appointments, contact with referral sources, etc.) as necessary to clients in assessment process.

Facilitates orientation to the program for newly referred clients, ensuring client understands and agrees to the service and ensuring compliance with agency policies. Clearly and concisely advise clients regarding program guidelines.

Completes all required documentation (e.g., progress notes, treatment referrals to referral source, scoring DAST or RIASI) following established Wheeler Clinic protocol.

Attends all clinical supervision/training session as required.

Communicates client/agency issues to the Program Manager in a timely manner.

Submits vouchers within one month of the date of service.

Continues to develop knowledge and understanding about the history, traditions, values, family systems, and artistic expression of groups served as well as uses appropriate methodological approaches, skills, and techniques that reflect an understanding of culture.

Wheeler Clinic is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Apply Now

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
